Posts.Content: I'm wonderin if anyone else has had a rash with either Aromasin or Femara.  I was on Aromasin but after 9 mo. a terrible rash developed on my buttocks.  I changed to Femara thinking it would go away, but it is still there and 3 doctors have not been able to come up with any solution. My oncologist says it is not caused by the medication.  I'm looking for anyone who will agree with me on this problem.
Posts.Title: Aromasin or Femara developed rash

Posts.Content: On Dec 23, 2010 12:03 AM yorkydee wrote: Question:  One week after I stopped taking Femara, I started Aromasin.  I've been on Aromasin for 9 days now.  I'm getting little headaches which is not common for me.  Has anyone on Aromasin experienced headaches?  Is this an Aromasin side effect?  Other than the headaches I seem to be doing better, but I haven't been on it that long.  Thank you. I was on Aromasin for 10 months.  In the beginning it wasn't bad.  Then after a few months the headaches came, sometimes lasting days until I would skp a pill or two to make it go away.  Then a rash developed which became very bad.  I switched to Femara and felt much better.  Headaches come and go with hot flashes,but not constant. I still have the rash but it is much better.  I have been to 3 Drs. who haven't found anything for the rash.  My next step is to see s dermatologist.  I think my body can stand a certain medication only so long then it lets me know.  I don't know how long I will be able to take Femara, but I find that sometimes if I just skp 1 pill I can break the cycle and feel better.  My oncologist isn't happy with that, but I can't help it.
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Posts.Content: I'm looking for someone who is or has been taking Aromasin.  Two months ago my Dr. decided to try it since my cancer returned after 12 years and it is inoperable.  I noticed some side affects, but this week I began having terrible back pain which got worse each day.  I decided it ws the meds. so I quit and my back is now getting better each day.  Has anyone else had this happen and did you stay on the medication or stop completely? Incidently I also have Ovarian cancer and was on Gemzar for that (and breast cancer) but am taking a break from the chemo to see how the Aromasin works. Any comments would be appreciated. Gayle
Posts.Title: Aromasin for Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: I can't believe you took it for 5 years.  What kind of side effects did you have with it?  I've been on it for 2 months. Gayle
Posts.Title: Stopping Aromasin

Posts.Content: On 6/25/2009 kaybell wrote: I do not get mammograms anymore since I had both breasts removed. I think you should talk to a plastic surgeon and see what they think about getting a reduction on one side and reconstruction on the other so you will feel balanced! Good luck. Deborah I had the left breast removed, right breast reduced, and implant on left all in one operation....not a good idea but it did work., lots of pain for quite a while.   This was 12 years ago.  I had pain every time they added more saline to the implant.   Finally I said enough!  The two breasts don't match, but put a bra on and I'm good to go...much better than a prosthesis.  I still have a tight feeling in the implant, but no pain.  Good luck with your decisions.
Posts.Title: post reconstruction pain

Posts.Content: A few comments on the implants.  I had a single mastectomy 12 years ago.  My breast were so large -DD - that I asked to have the other breast reduced and an implant for the breast removed.  I had no idea the pain I would have from the implant.  First, I wanted much smaller breasts, but the plastic surgeon convinced me that a "C" would be best.  I think if the implant had been smaller I would not have had as much pain.  It has now been in for 12 years with no problems - it is higher than the other breast, but once I get a bra on, things look pretty good.  And, the pain is gone most of the time.  I always feel a tightness there and feel I need to wear a bra while sleeping to keep things where they should be. If you do get implants, keep them small, and I wish I had had a double mastectomy even though there has been no cancer in the good breast.  However there is breast cancer in a lumph node under my sternum which they are treating along with the peritoneal they found 3 years ago.    If I had had a hysterectomy after the breast cancer, I would not have two cancers today. Good luck with you decision.  There are many factors to think about and you are doing the right thing by asking questions.  I should have done a little more research, but at the time I was so worried about the cancer, it was consuming me.  I'm now a well-seasoned cancer patient and research everything and drive everyone nuts asking questions. Let us know what you decide to do. Gayle
Posts.Title: breast reconstruction

Posts.Content: I certainly would recommend all breast cancer patients to have their ovaries removed.  If I had done that 12 years ago, I would not have ovarian/peritoneal cancer now.  Once you get ovarian, its surgery, chemo, and after that there are few options but chemo forever in order to keep it from spreading further. A Teal Warrier as well as Pink Warrier Gayle
Posts.Title: breast cancer patient advised to undergo genetic testing
